document.docAuthor: Shen, Rongrong, He, Yingnan, Pan, Zhaohui & Liu, Xingyue
document.docTitle: Inocellia fulvostigmata U. Aspock, Rausch & H. Aspock 1968
document.masterDocTitle: Discovery of Raphidioptera (Insecta: Neuropterida) in Xizang, China, with description of a new species of Inocellia Schneider

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Discovery of Raphidioptera (Insecta: Neuropterida) in Xizang, China, with description of a new species of Inocellia Schneider

heading.emphasis:
Key to males of
I. fulvostigmata
species-group

paragraph.keyLead:
1. Gonocoxite 9 in caudal view with a ventral lobe (
Liu et al . 2012
: fig. 15); fused gonocoxites 11 medially domed, but without conspicuous protrusion posteriad (
Liu et al . 2012
: fig. 16)..................................................... 2

- Gonocoxite 9 in caudal view without ventral lobe (
Liu et al . 2010b
: fig. 20); fused gonocoxites 11 medially with conspicuous protrusion posteriad (
Liu et al . 2010b
: fig. 22).............................................................. 5

2. Endophallus without bristles (H.
Aspöck et al . 1991
: fig. 2518)...............
I. bhutana H. Aspöck, U. Aspöck & Rausch

3. Gonocoxite 9 proximally with a subtriangular projection on ventral margin ( Liu & Sudhanya 2015 : fig. 5)... ..
I. indica Liu & Sudhanya

- Gonocoxite 9 proximally without a subtriangular projection on ventral margin (
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 37).................4

4. Gonostylus 9 slender digitiform (U.
Aspöck et al . 2011
: fig. 6); endophallus with only one pair of tufts on dorsal surfaces (U.
Aspöck et al . 2011
: fig. 3)........................................
I. longispina U. Aspöck, Liu, Rausch & H. Aspöck

- Gonostylus 9 unguiform (
Liu et al . 2012
: fig. 15); endophallus with five tufts on both dorsal and ventral surface (
Liu et al . 2012
: figs. 14, 16)….......................................................
I. yunnanica Liu, H. Aspöck & U. Aspöck

5. Gonocoxite 9 with an additional process anterior to gonostylus 9 on inner side (U.
Aspöck et al . 2011
: fig. 47)…........................................................................
I. cornuta U. Aspöck, Liu, Rausch & H. Aspöck

- Gonocoxite 9 without additional process anterior to gonostylus 9 on inner side (
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 31)….............. 6

- Gonostylus 9 membranous ( Figs. 10, 11 ; U. Aspöck & H. Aspöck 1968 : figs. 1b, 1c; H.
Aspöck et al . 1982
: fig. 32)........14

7. Gonostylus 9 bilobed (U.
Aspöck et al . 2011
: fig. 13)................. ......
I. bilobata U. Aspöck, Liu, Rausch & H. Aspöck

8. Gonostylus 9 distinctly prominent (U.
Aspöck et al. 2011
: figs. 32, 33, 34;
Liu et al. 2010b
: figs. 18, 19, 20)…............9

- Gonostylus 9 feebly prominent or strongly reduced (
Liu et al. 2013
: figs. 7, 8;
Liu et al. 2010b
: figs. 9, 10)..............13

9. Gonocoxite 9 with a tuft anterior to gonostylus 9 on inner side (
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 21)…...........................10

- Gonocoxite 9 without tuft anterior to gonostylus 9 on inner side (
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 39)...........................12

10. Gonostylus 9 broadly domed (
Liu et al. 2010b
: figs. 29, 30, 31); fused gonocoxites 11 posteriorly without projection (
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 32)............................................…
I. obtusangularis Liu, H. Aspöck, Yang & U. Aspöck

- Gonostylus 9 nearly cone-like or distally with a geniculate claw, curved dorsad (
Liu et al. 2010b
: figs. 18, 19, 20); fused gonocoxites 11 posteriorly with a distally forked projection (U.
Aspöck et al . 2011
: fig. 32;
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 20)..........11

11. Gonostylus 9 nearly cone-like with obtuse apex (U.
Aspöck et al. 2011
: figs. 32, 33, 34); fused gonocoxites 11 slightly broadened ventrad, without projection on ventromedian portion (U.
Aspöck et al. 2011
: fig. 34)............................................................................................
I. striata U. Aspöck, Liu, Rausch & H. Aspöck

- Gonostylus 9 distally with a geniculate claw, curved dorsad (
Liu et al. 2010b
: figs. 18, 19, 20); fused gonocoxites 11 narrowed ventrad, with a pair of small projections on ventromedian portion (
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 20)...........................................................................................
I. hamata Liu, H. Aspöck, Yang & U. Aspöck

12. Gonostylus 9 subtriangular, with a number of tiny dentations distally (
Liu et al. 2014
: figs. 3, 4, 5); fused gonocoxites 11 with a pair of projections near dorsal margin and with arcuately concaved ventral margin (
Liu et al. 2014
: fig. 7)….................................................................................. ..
I. rara Liu, H. Aspöck & U. Aspöck

- Gonostylus 9 unguiform, without any dentations (
Liu et al. 2010b
: figs. 36, 37, 38); fused gonocoxites 11 with a pair of projections at middle and without distinctly concaved ventral margin (
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 40)................
I. sinensis Navás

13. Gonostylus 9 broadly domed (
Liu et al. 2013
: figs. 7, 8); fused gonocoxites 11 slightly broadened ventrad, with prominent ventrolateral corners (
Liu et al. 2013
: fig. 10).......................... …
I. hainanica Liu, H. Aspöck, Bi & U. Aspöck

- Gonostylus 9 strongly reduced as a small tubercular process (
Liu et al. 2010b
: figs. 9, 10); fused gonocoxites 11 not broadened ventrad, with obtuse ventrolateral corners (
Liu et al. 2010b
: fig. 11).......... ..
I. cheni Liu, H. Aspöck, Yang & U. Aspöck

14. Gonostylus 9 presents as a digitiform process ( Fig. 8 ); fused gonocoxites 11 subtriangular in caudal view ( Fig. 12 )............................................................................................ …
I. tibetana
sp. nov.

- Gonostylus 9 presents as a broadly domed process; fused gonocoxites 11 subquadrate in caudal view (H. Aspöck & U. Aspöck. 1968: fig. 1d; H.
Aspöck et al. 1982
: fig. 39)
I. fulvostigmata U. Aspöck & H. Aspöck
….............................15

15. Pterostigma yellow (H. Aspöck & U. Aspöck 1968 : fig. 1h; H.
Aspöck et al. 1982
: figs. 26, 27)................................................................................ ..
I. fulvostigmata fulvostigmata U. Aspöck & H. Aspöck

- Pterostigma brown (H. Aspöck et al. 1982 : figs. 28, 29).....
I. fulvostigmata nigrostigmata H. Aspöck, U. Aspöck & Rausch
